responsibilities.responsibility: Led a team of 5 frontend developers in the Canon B2B project and collaborated with other teams to ensure that project goals are met. Tracked progress and ensured that all team members were meeting deadlines. Actively engaged with the client and solution architects, addressed the timeline of developing the front end, disclosed pain points in the existing application, and provided cost-cutting operation suggestions by going serverless for email notification microservice.
Primarily developed the front end of the Canon B2B E-commerce site using React. Utilized React Redux and Redux Saga to manage asynchronous API calls and to update data states.

Created a microservice using Spring Boot (Java) which organized and consolidated all the orders to the freight order depending on the delivery location and recorded it to Oracle DB. Deployed the microservice to the AWS Elastic Kubernetes cluster in a private subnet inside AWS VPC. Utilized Jenkins CI/CD to automate test validation and deployment process

Implemented a serverless microservice and utilized SendGrid bindings which sends the predefined email notification triggered from the Apache Kafka events. As a result, it has drastically reduced the operational expense as compared to traditional deployment by 90%

Leveraged AWS CloudFront (Content Delivery Network) to quickly stream small and large media files (images) with optimized delivery. As a result, it improved the user experience of the web app and reduced load times by at least 50%
